TAXONOMIC CLASS.content:
TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, mixed, active, mesic Typic Paleaquults
Depth Class: Very deep
Agricultural Drainage Class: Poorly drained
Permeability: Slow
Internal Free Water Occurance: Very shallow; Persistent
Index Surface Runoff: Low
Parent Material: Clayey marine sediments
Slope: 0 to 2 percent
MEAN Annual Air Temperature (type location): 56 degrees F.
MEAN Annual Precipitation (type location): 44 inches
TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, mixed, active, mesic Typic Paleaquults

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Trussum silt loam, on a smooth 1 percent, slope in woodland. (Colors are for moist soil.)
Oi--0 to 1 inch; roots and slightly decomposed plant material.
A--1 to 4 inches; dark brown (10YR 3/3) silt loam; moderate fine and medium granular structure; very friable; nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and few fine and coarse roots; extremely acid; abrupt smooth boundary.  (3 to 9 inches thick)
E--4 to 8 inches; grayish brown (2.5Y 5/2) silt loam; weak fine and medium subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, non plastic; common very fine, fine, and medium roots and few coarse roots; few medium distinct olive yellow (2.5Y 6/6) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; extremely acid; clear smooth boundary. (0 to 9 inches thick)
Btg1--8 to 16 inches; gray (10YR 6/1) silty clay loam; moderate fine and medium subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few fine roots; continuous distinct clay films on ped faces and in pores; common medium distinct brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) irregularly shaped soft iron masses with clear boundaries throughout; very strongly acid; clear smooth boundary.
Btg2--16 to 28 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) and white (10YR 8/1) clay; moderate fine and medium angular blocky structure; firm; sticky, plastic; few very fine and fine roots; distinct continuous clay films on ped faces and in pores; very strongly acid; diffuse smooth boundary.
Btg3--28 to 42 inches; light gray (10YR 7/1) and light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) silty clay; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very firm; moderately sticky, moderately plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few distinct discontinuous clay films on ped faces and in pores; common medium prominent reddish yellow (7.5YR 6/8) and few distinct brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) irregularly shaped soft iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; very strongly acid; diffuse smooth boundary.
Btg4--42 to 57 inches; light gray (2.5Y 7/2) clay loam; weak coarse platy structure parting to weak medium subangular blocky structure; firm; slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few fine roots; distinct discontinuous clay films and few distinct discontinuous silt skeletons on faces of peds and in pores; common medium prominent reddish yellow (7.5YR 6/6) and few medium faint light yellowish brown (2.5Y 6/4) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; extremely acid; diffuse wavy boundary. (Combined thickness of the Btg is more than 40 inches.)
BCtg--57 to 81 inches; light gray (2.5Y 7/2) clay loam; massive; firm; slightly sticky, moderately plastic; few fine roots; faint discontinuous clay films and distinct discontinuous silt skeletons in pores; common fine prominent strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) and few fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 4/6) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout and few medium faint light olive gray (5Y 6/2) irregularly shaped iron depletions with diffuse boundaries throughout; very strongly acid. (0 to 20 inches thick)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Sussex County, Delaware; in woodland about 60 feet south of power line, and about 1650 feet west and 1,700 feet south of the junction of State Rte. 68 and county road 454A, northeast of Delmar; lat. 38 degrees 28 minutes 26 seconds N. and long. 75 degrees 33 minutes 02 seconds W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.section: RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS & RANGE OF INDIVIDUAL HORIZONS
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Depth to the Base of the Argillic: Greater then 60 inches
Depth to Bedrock: Greater than 60 inches
Depth to Seasonal High Water Table: 0 to 12 inches, November to May
Rock Fragments: 0 to 10 percent, by volume throughout the profile, mostly fine gravel
Soil Reaction: Extremely acid to strongly acid throughout the profile, unless limed & RANGE OF INDIVIDUAL HORIZONS:
A or Ap horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR or 2.5Y, value of 3 or 4, chroma of 1 to 3
Texture--silt loam, loam or fine sandy loam
E or Eg horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR or 2.5Y, value of 4 to 6, chroma of 1 or 2, or is neutral with value of 3 to 8
Texture--silt loam, loam, or fine sandy loam
Redoximorphic Features--iron depletions in shades of olive, gray, or white and iron masses in shades of red, brown, yellow, or olive
Btg horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR to 2.5Y, value of 4 to 8, chroma of 1 or 2, or is neutral with value of 4 to 8
Texture--clay, silty clay, silty clay loam, or clay loam
Redoximorphic Features--iron depletions in shades of olive, gray, or white and iron masses in shades of red, brown, yellow, or olive
BCg horizon:
hue of 10YR through 5Y, value of 4 to 7, chroma of 1 or 2, or is neutral with value of 4 to 8
Texture--clay, sandy clay, clay loam, or sandy clay loam
Redoximorphic Features--iron depletions in shades of olive, gray, or white and iron masses in shades of red, brown, yellow, or olive
Cg horizon (if it occurs):
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, value of 4 to 7, chroma of 1 or 2, or is neutral with value of 4 to 7
Texture--ranges from loamy sand to sandy clay loam
Redoximorphic Features--iron depletions in shades of olive, gray, or white and iron masses in shades of red, brown, yellow, or olive

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landscape: Mid-Atlantic Coastal Plain
Landform: Low-lying uplands, interfluves, terraces, and shallow depressions
Elevation: 2 to 200 feet
Parent Material: Clayey marine sediments
Mean Annual Air Temperature: 50 to 58 degrees F.
Mean Annual Precipitation: 38 to 48 inches
Frost Free Period: 190 to 210 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Elkton soils--very poorly drained and have a fine-silty particle-size control section, on lowlands, depressions, and ancient flood plains
Keyport soils--moderately well drained, on higher landforms
Matawan soils--moderately well drained and have a fine-loamy particle-size control section, on higher landforms

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:
Agricultural Drainage Class: Poorly drained
Permeability: Slow
Internal Free Water Occurance: Very shallow; Persistent
Index Surface Runoff: Low

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Major Uses: Woodland. A few small areas where artificial drained are used for cultivated crops, mostly corn and soybeans.
Dominant Vegetation: Wooded areas are dominantly red maple, sweetgum, blackgum, and willow oak.  The understory vegetation commonly consists of American Holly, sweetbay, greenbriar and highbush blueberry.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content:
DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:
Distribution: Mid-Atlantic Coastal Plain of Delaware, New Jersey, and Maryland
Extent: Moderate

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Raleigh, North Carolina

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: These soils were previously included with the Elkton series.  The 2021 revision adjusts the horizon depths to allow the Oi horizon to be the surface of the pedon.
Diagnostic horizons and other diagnostic soil characteristics recognized in this pedon are:
Ochric epipedon--the zone form the soil surface to 7 inches (A and E horizons)
Albic horizon--the zone from 3 to 7 inches (E horizon)
Argillic horizon--the zone from 7 to 56 inches (Btg and BCg horizons)
Aquic conditions--the zone from 3 inches to a depth of 80 inches is periodically saturated (endosaturation)

HORIZONS.name: Oi
HORIZONS.narrative: Oi--0 to 1 inch; roots and slightly decomposed plant material.

HORIZONS.name: A
HORIZONS.narrative: A--1 to 4 inches; dark brown (10YR 3/3) silt loam; moderate fine and medium granular structure; very friable; nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and few fine and coarse roots; extremely acid; abrupt smooth boundary.  (3 to 9 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: E
HORIZONS.structure: weak fine and medium subangular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: E--4 to 8 inches; grayish brown (2.5Y 5/2) silt loam; weak fine and medium subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, non plastic; common very fine, fine, and medium roots and few coarse roots; few medium distinct olive yellow (2.5Y 6/6) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; extremely acid; clear smooth boundary. (0 to 9 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Btg1
HORIZONS.structure: moderate fine and medium subangular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: Btg1--8 to 16 inches; gray (10YR 6/1) silty clay loam; moderate fine and medium subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few fine roots; continuous distinct clay films on ped faces and in pores; common medium distinct brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) irregularly shaped soft iron masses with clear boundaries throughout; very strongly acid; clear smooth boundary.

HORIZONS.name: Btg2
HORIZONS.structure: moderate fine and medium angular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: Btg2--16 to 28 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) and white (10YR 8/1) clay; moderate fine and medium angular blocky structure; firm; sticky, plastic; few very fine and fine roots; distinct continuous clay films on ped faces and in pores; very strongly acid; diffuse smooth boundary.

HORIZONS.name: Btg3
HORIZONS.narrative: Btg3--28 to 42 inches; light gray (10YR 7/1) and light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) silty clay; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very firm; moderately sticky, moderately plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few distinct discontinuous clay films on ped faces and in pores; common medium prominent reddish yellow (7.5YR 6/8) and few distinct brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) irregularly shaped soft iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; very strongly acid; diffuse smooth boundary.

HORIZONS.name: Btg4
HORIZONS.narrative: Btg4--42 to 57 inches; light gray (2.5Y 7/2) clay loam; weak coarse platy structure parting to weak medium subangular blocky structure; firm; slightly sticky, slightly plastic; few fine roots; distinct discontinuous clay films and few distinct discontinuous silt skeletons on faces of peds and in pores; common medium prominent reddish yellow (7.5YR 6/6) and few medium faint light yellowish brown (2.5Y 6/4) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout; extremely acid; diffuse wavy boundary. (Combined thickness of the Btg is more than 40 inches.)

HORIZONS.name: BCtg
HORIZONS.narrative: BCtg--57 to 81 inches; light gray (2.5Y 7/2) clay loam; massive; firm; slightly sticky, moderately plastic; few fine roots; faint discontinuous clay films and distinct discontinuous silt skeletons in pores; common fine prominent strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) and few fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 4/6) irregularly shaped iron masses with diffuse boundaries throughout and few medium faint light olive gray (5Y 6/2) irregularly shaped iron depletions with diffuse boundaries throughout; very strongly acid. (0 to 20 inches thick)
